title: Pawfect Care landing page expansion (Chewy/VetCare-style sections, theme blue, services + images, FAQs/support)

requirements.summary: Add a Chewy/VetCare-style “What is Pawfect Care” overview section before Services with grooming expectations, importance of care, and Chewy-verified vendor trust copy.
acceptanceCriteria: A distinct overview section appears between the Hero and Services sections in frontend/src/components/PawfectCareLanding.tsx.
The section text is in English, grooming-focused, and includes the vendor partnership + Chewy-verified trust message.
The section does not replace the existing Services section; it precedes it.

file_operations.description: Insert a new “What is Pawfect Care” section between the Hero and Services sections, using a Chewy/VetCare-like layout (clean, rounded, spacious). Include English grooming-focused copy covering: (1) what customers can expect, (2) why pet care is important, and (3) trust messaging that Pawfect Care works with almost 100s of vendor partners and they’re Chewy-verified. Incorporate a mixed image layout using uploaded spa-cat + bath imagery and ensure images use consistent aspect ratios and include width/height (or equivalent) to prevent layout shift.

requirements.summary: Add a Chewy/VetCare-style “Membership plans” section for grooming that communicates availability and benefits without any prices.
acceptanceCriteria: A membership section exists on the page with a short intro and benefit bullets, and contains no prices.
The visual styling aligns with the existing Chewy/VetCare-inspired look (rounded, spacious, clean).

file_operations.description: Add a “Membership plans” section (single-page, no new routes) with Chewy/VetCare-inspired layout and simple benefit bullets (no pricing, no checkout). Use one relevant uploaded image as a supporting visual and keep styling consistent with existing rounded Card/Badge/Button patterns.

requirements.summary: Adjust global theme tokens so primary CTAs/links use a darker Chewy/VetCare-like blue and primary text remains readable near #121212, using existing CSS variable + Tailwind token approach.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary buttons/links use a darker, Chewy-like blue (not the current lighter blue).
Foreground text remains readable and consistent with var(--chirp-text-primary, #121212) for primary text (or closest theme equivalent).
Color changes are applied via the existing theme token approach (CSS variables in frontend/src/index.css and Tailwind token usage), not hard-coded ad-hoc per component.

file_operations.description: Update theme CSS variables to a darker Chewy/VetCare-like brand blue by adjusting --primary and related tokens (e.g., --ring, sidebar primary) while keeping the existing typography direction. Align primary text toward #121212 by adjusting the base foreground token if needed, ensuring contrast/readability. Do not hard-code ad-hoc colors in individual components; rely on existing Tailwind token usage (text-primary, bg-primary, ring-primary, etc.).

requirements.summary: Add a Chewy/VetCare-style “Convenient access to care” detail row with a mobile-in-hand icon and grooming-specific copy.
acceptanceCriteria: A row/section exists with a small phone/mobile-in-hand icon preceding the heading, followed by supporting text and an optional link-style CTA.
Copy is grooming-focused and does not mention veterinary-only concepts.

file_operations.description: Create a small reusable React icon component that visually represents a mobile-in-hand (simple inline SVG or icon composition) sized for use to the left of a heading. Keep it styleable via className so it can match the Chewy-blue theme.

Add a “Convenient access to care” row/section in a Chewy/VetCare-like layout (small icon to the left of heading + body). Use the new MobileInHandIcon before the heading. Copy must be grooming-specific (booking, appointment updates, groomer notes, before/after guidance) and may include an optional link-style CTA.

requirements.summary: Expand Services with dedicated Nail Trimming and Teeth Cleaning service cards using consistent Chewy-style cards, suitable icons, and uploaded images.
acceptanceCriteria: Services section includes clear service entries for Nail Trimming and Teeth Cleaning (as their own items or clearly called out service cards).
Each added service has appropriate imagery from the uploaded set and consistent card sizing/cropping with existing service cards.

file_operations.description: Update the Services card grid to add two additional cards: “Nail Trimming” and “Teeth Cleaning”. Use lucide-react icons appropriate for each (e.g., a scissor/clipper-like icon for nails and a tooth/smile-like icon for teeth) and match existing Card layout, sizing, hover behavior, and rounded styling. Assign uploaded images that best match each service (e.g., image-3.png for nail trimming, image-2.png for teeth cleaning) and ensure consistent aspect ratio/cropping with the other service cards.

requirements.summary: Place all uploaded images cohesively across the landing page, fix any broken image paths, and add an end-of-page responsive gallery/strip before the footer.
acceptanceCriteria: All listed uploaded images are present somewhere on the page and load successfully (no broken images).
The overview section uses a mix of the spa-cat and bath imagery (not only one).
A dedicated end-of-page gallery/strip exists and displays the requested end images in a consistent grid/strip (responsive), before the footer.
Image presentation uses consistent aspect ratios/cropping and does not cause layout shifts on load.

requirements.summary: Add end-of-page grooming FAQs (accordion) and a Chewy-blue “Need help?” support panel before the footer.
acceptanceCriteria: An FAQ accordion section appears near the end of the page and contains grooming-related Q&A items.
A “Need help?” support panel follows the FAQ section and visually resembles the Chewy/VetCare reference structure (blue panel, clear contact area).
Both sections appear at the end of the page (after main content sections) and before the final footer area.

file_operations.description: Add an end-of-page “FAQs” section using the shadcn-ui Accordion component for Q&A (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.). Populate with English, grooming-specific questions/answers (appointments, what to bring, coat types, nail/teeth add-ons, anxious pets, etc.). Directly after, add a Chewy-style blue “Need help?” support panel with clear contact placeholders (phone/email/hours) styled using theme tokens (bg-primary, text-primary-foreground, rounded corners) and placed before the existing footer.
